title.narrative: DWAI- Health Info. for Deaf Women

description.narrative:
Deaf Women Aloud Initiative (DWAI) Project Summary:
This project will focus on possible collaboration with Deaf Women Associationof Nigeria and other organisations such as health providers, Deaf Community to develop a health specific sign language glossary that will be useful to Deaf community especially Deaf Women and girls; ensure they gain access to SRH services in the health facilities as well as enable the health practitioners to be prepared towards meeting the health needs of Deaf women at their facilities
Theabsence and cost of hiring sign language interpreters# services by the Deaf women and girls to access their sexual and reproductivehealth rights within the health facilities in Nigeria particularly in Abuja has often limited their chance to quality sexual and reproductive health services thereby, increasing the rate of maternal mortality and morbidity among deaf women and their families, especially children. As a result of this, many deaf women do not go to health facilities for care while the few that do so are often neglected and/or ignored at health facilities by the health workers due to communication gap and other discriminatory attitudes.
The situation is aggravated by non-availability of disability-friendly health and specific sign-language information, low sensitization and awareness creation on the issues of sexual reproductive health rights (SRHR) of Deaf women and their children among stakeholdersand health practitioners in Nigeria and limited leadership skills recorded among deaf women and their community leaders to be able to negotiate for their full inclusion into sexual and reproductive health rights program.

participating-org.narrative:
Deaf Women Aloud Initiative (DWAI) is an organisation that is poised to amplify the voice of the deaf women in Nigeria and other Africa countries whose voices have been drowned by the convention of the right of persons with Disabilities (CRPD) and status-quo. DWAI exists to mitigate the exploitation of deaf women, eliminate discrimination, promote social inclusion and enhance secular participation of deaf women in Nigeria. DWAI also promotes political participation of women with disabilities and rehabilitation of deaf women. It also poised to raise awareness among general populations about sensitive issues that affect deaf people. Issues like sexual and reproductive Health Rights (SRHR), sexual abuse, gender based violence, injustices, stigmatization and discrimination. DWAI will promote policy formulation and their implementation to enhance the lives of people with disabilities
Vision: To redefine deafness and create a society where every deaf person is heard and accepted in all social strata. Mission: To empower deaf people to claim access to information, health services, education, business and employment opportunities for purposeful living. Motto: Living meaningfully with deafness.

Dorothy Njemanze 08035523954 7. Adedoyin Beyioku-Alase deafwomenng@yahoo.com 08053367595 (SMS Only) 8. Peter Gideon gideonp11@gmail.com 08060802873
Goals/Objectives 1. To mitigate the exploitation of deaf women, eliminate discrimination, promote social inclusion and enhance secular participation of deaf women in Nigeria. 2. To promotes political participation and rehabilitation of Deaf women and youth 3. To raise awareness among general populations about sensitive issues that affect deaf women. Issues like sexual and reproductive Health Rights (SRHR), sexual abuse, gender based violence, injustices, stigmatization and discrimination. 4. To promote policy formulation and their implementation to enhance the lives of women with disabilities especially Deaf Women. 5. To amplify the voice of Deaf women and girls in the society 6. To sensitize and build the capacity of Deaf women and young girls to access to Sexual and Reproductive Health (SRH), maternity services and GBV in sign-language communication. 7. To empower deaf women and young girls who are out of schools or jobless with entrepreneurship development and vocational skills training through collaboration so that they can earn some money and become self reliance. 8.To empower and educate Deaf students especially girls on personal hygiene, menstruation and other factors particular to womanhood that are sometimes not taught. 9. To advocacy and empower Deaf Women with the right information on fundamental human rightsand social responsibilities, especially as it#s related to CRPD.
10. To collaborate or partner with local stakeholder, NGOs or CSOs to mainstreaming deaf women matters and sign-language communication into their services and program.
